subsectiontext: Without limiting the generality of section 718.2, where a court imposes a sentence for an offence referred to in section 380, 382, 382.1 or 400, it shall consider the following as aggravating circumstances:
paragraphText: in committing the offence, the offender took advantage of the high regard in which the offender was held in the community;

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Without limiting the generality of section 718.2, where a court imposes a sentence for an offence referred to in section 380, 382, 382.1 or 400, it shall consider the following as aggravating circumstances:
paragraphText: the offender did not comply with a licensing requirement, or professional standard, that is normally applicable to the activity or conduct that forms the subject-matter of the offence; and

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Without limiting the generality of section 718.2, where a court imposes a sentence for an offence referred to in section 380, 382, 382.1 or 400, it shall consider the following as aggravating circumstances:
paragraphText: the offender concealed or destroyed records related to the fraud or to the disbursement of the proceeds of the fraud.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Without limiting the generality of section 718.2, when a court imposes a sentence for an offence referred to in section 382, 382.1 or 400, it shall also consider as an aggravating circumstance the fact that the value of the fraud committed exceeded one million dollars.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: When a court imposes a sentence for an offence referred to in section 380, 382, 382.1 or 400, it shall not consider as mitigating circumstances the offender’s employment, employment skills or status or reputation in the community if those circumstances were relevant to, contributed to, or were used in the commission of the offence.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: The court shall cause to be stated in the record the aggravating and mitigating circumstances it took into account when determining the sentence.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: When an offender is convicted, or is discharged on the conditions prescribed in a probation order under section 730, of an offence referred to in subsection 380(1), the court that sentences or discharges the offender, in addition to any other punishment that may be imposed for that offence or any other condition prescribed in the order of discharge, may make, subject to the conditions or exemptions that the court directs, an order prohibiting the offender from seeking, obtaining or continuing any employment, or becoming or being a volunteer in any capacity, that involves having authority over the real property, money or valuable security of another person.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: The prohibition may be for any period that the court considers appropriate, including any period to which the offender is sentenced to imprisonment.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: A court that makes an order of prohibition or, if the court is for any reason unable to act, another court of equivalent jurisdiction in the same province, may, on application of the offender or the prosecutor, require the offender to appear before it at any time and, after hearing the parties, that court may vary the conditions prescribed in the order if, in the opinion of the court, the variation is desirable because of changed circumstances.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every person who is bound by an order of prohibition and who does not comply with the order is guilty of
paragraphText: an indictable offence and is liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years; or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every person who is bound by an order of prohibition and who does not comply with the order is guilty of
paragraphText: an offence punishable on summary conviction.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Fraudulent manipulation of stock exchange transactions
sectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than 10 years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who, through the facility of a stock exchange, curb market or other market, with intent to create a false or misleading appearance of active public trading in a security or with intent to create a false or misleading appearance with respect to the market price of a security,

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than 10 years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who, directly or indirectly, buys or sells a security, knowingly using inside information that they
paragraphText: possess by virtue of being a shareholder of the issuer of that security;

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than 10 years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who, directly or indirectly, buys or sells a security, knowingly using inside information that they
paragraphText: possess by virtue of, or obtained in the course of, their business or professional relationship with that issuer;

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than 10 years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who, directly or indirectly, buys or sells a security, knowingly using inside information that they
paragraphText: possess by virtue of, or obtained in the course of, a proposed takeover or reorganization of, or amalgamation, merger or similar business combination with, that issuer;

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than 10 years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who, directly or indirectly, buys or sells a security, knowingly using inside information that they
paragraphText: possess by virtue of, or obtained in the course of, their employment, office, duties or occupation with that issuer or with a person referred to in paragraphs (a) to (c); or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than 10 years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who, directly or indirectly, buys or sells a security, knowingly using inside information that they
paragraphText: obtained from a person who possesses or obtained the information in a manner referred to in paragraphs (a) to (d).

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Except when necessary in the course of business, a person who knowingly conveys inside information that they possess or obtained in a manner referred to in subsection (1) to another person, knowing that there is a risk that the person will use the information to buy or sell, directly or indirectly, a security to which the information relates, or that they may convey the information to another person who may buy or sell such a security, is guilty of
paragraphText: an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years; or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Except when necessary in the course of business, a person who knowingly conveys inside information that they possess or obtained in a manner referred to in subsection (1) to another person, knowing that there is a risk that the person will use the information to buy or sell, directly or indirectly, a security to which the information relates, or that they may convey the information to another person who may buy or sell such a security, is guilty of
paragraphText: an offence punishable on summary conviction.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: For greater certainty, an act is not an offence under this section if it is authorized or required, or is not prohibited, by any federal or provincial Act or regulation applicable to it.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: In this section, inside information means information relating to or affecting the issuer of a security or a security that they have issued, or are about to issue, that
paragraphText: has not been generally disclosed; and

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: In this section, inside information means information relating to or affecting the issuer of a security or a security that they have issued, or are about to issue, that
paragraphText: could reasonably be expected to significantly affect the market price or value of a security of the issuer.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who, with intent to make gain or profit by the rise or fall in price of the stock of an incorporated or unincorporated company or undertaking, whether in or outside Canada, or of any goods, wares or merchandise,
paragraphText: makes or signs, or authorizes to be made or signed, any contract or agreement, oral or written, purporting to be for the sale or purchase of shares of stock or goods, wares or merchandise in respect of which no delivery of the thing sold or purchased is made or received, and without the bona fide intention of making or receiving delivery thereof, as the case may be.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who, with intent to make gain or profit by the rise or fall in price of the stock of an incorporated or unincorporated company or undertaking, whether in or outside Canada, or of any goods, wares or merchandise,
paragraphText: makes or signs, or authorizes to be made or signed, any contract or agreement, oral or written, purporting to be for the purchase or sale of shares of stock or goods, wares or merchandise, without the bona fide intention of acquiring the shares, goods, wares or merchandise or of selling them, as the case may be, or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Where, in proceedings under this section, it is established that the accused made or signed a contract or an agreement for the sale or purchase of shares of stock or goods, wares or merchandise, or acted, aided or abetted in the making or signing thereof, the burden of proof of a bona fide intention to acquire or to sell the shares, goods, wares or merchandise or to deliver or to receive delivery thereof, as the case may be, lies on the accused.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than two years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who, being a vendor, mortgagor or hypothecary debtor of property or a chose in action or an incorporeal right or being a lawyer or notary for or agent or mandatary of a vendor, mortgagor or hypothecary debtor of property, a chose in action or incorporeal right, is served with a written demand for an abstract of title by or on behalf of the purchaser, mortgagee or hypothecary creditor before the completion of the purchase, mortgage or hypothec, and who
paragraphText: with intent to defraud and for the purpose of inducing the purchaser, mortgagee or hypothecary creditor to accept the title offered or produced to them, conceals from them any settlement, deed, will or other instrument or act material to the title, or any encumbrance on the title, or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than two years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who, being a vendor, mortgagor or hypothecary debtor of property or a chose in action or an incorporeal right or being a lawyer or notary for or agent or mandatary of a vendor, mortgagor or hypothecary debtor of property, a chose in action or incorporeal right, is served with a written demand for an abstract of title by or on behalf of the purchaser, mortgagee or hypothecary creditor before the completion of the purchase, mortgage or hypothec, and who
paragraphText: falsifies any pedigree on which the title depends.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: No proceedings shall be instituted under this section without the consent of the Attorney General.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
sectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who, as principal, agent or mandatary in a proceeding to register title to real property or immovable property, or in a transaction relating to real property or immovable property that is or is proposed to be registered, knowingly and with intent to deceive,

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
sectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than two years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who knowingly,

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Fraudulent disposal of goods on which money advanced
subsectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than two years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who
paragraphText: knowingly and wilfully aids or assists any person to make a disposition of anything to which paragraph (a) applies for the purpose of deceiving, defrauding or injuring the consignee.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Fraudulent disposal of goods on which money advanced
subsectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than two years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who
paragraphText: having shipped or delivered to the keeper of a warehouse or to a factor, an agent or a carrier anything on which the consignee thereof has advanced money or has given valuable security, thereafter, with intent to deceive, defraud or injure the consignee, disposes of it in a manner that is different from and inconsistent with any agreement that has been made in that behalf between him and the consignee, or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Fraudulent disposal of goods on which money advanced
subsectiontext: No person is guilty of an offence under this section where, before disposing of anything in a manner that is different from and inconsistent with any agreement that has been made in that behalf between him and the consignee, he pays or tenders to the consignee the full amount of money or valuable security that the consignee has advanced.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Disposal of property to defraud creditors
sectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than two years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who,

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Fraud in relation to fares, etc.
subsectiontext: Every person whose duty it is to collect a fare, toll, ticket or admission and who intentionally does any of the following is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than two years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction:
paragraphText: accepts any valuable consideration for failing to collect it or for collecting less than the proper amount payable in respect thereof.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Fraud in relation to fares, etc.
subsectiontext: Every person whose duty it is to collect a fare, toll, ticket or admission and who intentionally does any of the following is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than two years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction:
paragraphText: fails to collect it,

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Fraud in relation to fares, etc.
subsectiontext: Every person whose duty it is to collect a fare, toll, ticket or admission and who intentionally does any of the following is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than two years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction:
paragraphText: collects less than the proper amount payable in respect thereof, or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Fraud in relation to fares, etc.
subsectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than two years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who gives or offers to a person whose duty it is to collect a fare, toll, ticket or admission fee any valuable consideration
paragraphText: for collecting an amount less than the amount payable in respect thereof.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Fraud in relation to fares, etc.
subsectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than two years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who gives or offers to a person whose duty it is to collect a fare, toll, ticket or admission fee any valuable consideration
paragraphText: for failing to collect it, or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Fraud in relation to fares, etc.
subsectiontext: Every one who, by any false pretence or fraud, unlawfully obtains transportation by land, water or air is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Fraud in relation to valuable minerals
subsectiontext: A person who contravenes subsection (1), (2) or (3) is guilty of
paragraphText: an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years; or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Fraud in relation to valuable minerals
subsectiontext: A person who contravenes subsection (1), (2) or (3) is guilty of
paragraphText: an offence punishable on summary conviction.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Fraud in relation to valuable minerals
subsectiontext: No person who is the holder of a lease or licence issued under an Act relating to the mining of valuable minerals, or by the owner of land that is supposed to contain valuable minerals, shall
paragraphText: by a fraudulent device or contrivance, defraud or attempt to defraud any person of
subparagraphText: any valuable minerals obtained under or reserved by the lease or licence, or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Fraud in relation to valuable minerals
subsectiontext: No person who is the holder of a lease or licence issued under an Act relating to the mining of valuable minerals, or by the owner of land that is supposed to contain valuable minerals, shall
paragraphText: by a fraudulent device or contrivance, defraud or attempt to defraud any person of
subparagraphText: any money or valuable interest or thing payable in respect of valuable minerals obtained or rights reserved by the lease or licence; or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Fraud in relation to valuable minerals
subsectiontext: No person who is the holder of a lease or licence issued under an Act relating to the mining of valuable minerals, or by the owner of land that is supposed to contain valuable minerals, shall
paragraphText: fraudulently conceal or make a false statement with respect to the amount of valuable minerals obtained under the lease or licence.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Fraud in relation to valuable minerals
subsectiontext: No person, other than the owner or the owner’s agent or someone otherwise acting under lawful authority, shall sell any valuable mineral that is unrefined, partly refined, uncut or otherwise unprocessed.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Fraud in relation to valuable minerals
subsectiontext: No person shall buy any valuable mineral that is unrefined, partly refined, uncut or otherwise unprocessed from anyone who the person has reason to believe is not the owner or the owner’s agent or someone otherwise acting under lawful authority.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Fraud in relation to valuable minerals
subsectiontext: In any proceeding in relation to subsection (2) or (3), in the absence of evidence raising a reasonable doubt to the contrary, it is presumed that
paragraphText: in the case of a sale, the seller is not the owner of the valuable mineral or the owner’s agent or someone otherwise acting under lawful authority; and

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Fraud in relation to valuable minerals
subsectiontext: In any proceeding in relation to subsection (2) or (3), in the absence of evidence raising a reasonable doubt to the contrary, it is presumed that
paragraphText: in the case of a purchase, the purchaser, when buying the valuable mineral, had reason to believe that the seller was not the owner of the mineral or the owner’s agent or someone otherwise acting under lawful authority.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Fraud in relation to valuable minerals
subsectiontext: If a person is convicted of an offence under this section, the court may order anything by means of or in relation to which the offence was committed, on such conviction, to be forfeited to Her Majesty.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Fraud in relation to valuable minerals
subsectiontext: Subsection (6) does not apply to real property other than real property built or significantly modified for the purpose of facilitating the commission of an offence under this section.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Possession of stolen or fraudulently obtained valuable minerals
subsectiontext: A person who contravenes subsection (1) is guilty of
paragraphText: an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years; or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Possession of stolen or fraudulently obtained valuable minerals
subsectiontext: A person who contravenes subsection (1) is guilty of
paragraphText: an offence punishable on summary conviction.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Possession of stolen or fraudulently obtained valuable minerals
subsectiontext: No person shall possess any valuable mineral that is unrefined, partly refined, uncut or otherwise unprocessed that has been stolen or dealt with contrary to section 394.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Possession of stolen or fraudulently obtained valuable minerals
subsectiontext: Reasonable grounds to believe that the valuable mineral has been stolen or dealt with contrary to section 394 are, in the absence of evidence raising a reasonable doubt to the contrary, proof that the valuable mineral has been stolen or dealt with contrary to section 394.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Possession of stolen or fraudulently obtained valuable minerals
subsectiontext: If a person is convicted of an offence under this section, the court may, on that conviction, order that anything by means of or in relation to which the offence was committed be forfeited to Her Majesty.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Possession of stolen or fraudulently obtained valuable minerals
subsectiontext: Subsection (4) does not apply to real property, other than real property built or significantly modified for the purpose of facilitating the commission of an offence under subsection (3).

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: A warrant issued under subsection (1) may be executed at any place in Canada. A public officer named in the warrant, or any peace officer, who executes the warrant must have authority to act in that capacity in the place where the warrant is executed.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: If an information in writing is laid under oath before a justice by a peace officer or by a public officer who has been appointed or designated to administer or enforce a federal or provincial law and whose duties include the enforcement of this Act or any other Act of Parliament and the justice is satisfied that there are reasonable grounds to believe that, contrary to this Act or any other Act of Parliament, any valuable mineral is deposited in a place or held by a person, the justice may issue a warrant authorizing a peace officer or a public officer, if the public officer is named in it, to search any of the places or persons mentioned in the information.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Where, on search, anything mentioned in subsection (1) is found, it shall be seized and carried before the justice who shall order
paragraphText: that it be detained for the purposes of an inquiry or a trial; or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Where, on search, anything mentioned in subsection (1) is found, it shall be seized and carried before the justice who shall order
paragraphText: if it is not detained for the purposes of an inquiry or a trial,
subparagraphText: that it be restored to the owner, or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Where, on search, anything mentioned in subsection (1) is found, it shall be seized and carried before the justice who shall order
paragraphText: if it is not detained for the purposes of an inquiry or a trial,
subparagraphText: that it be forfeited to Her Majesty in right of the province in which the proceedings take place if the owner cannot be ascertained.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: An appeal lies from an order made under paragraph (2)(b) in the manner in which an appeal lies in summary conviction proceedings under Part XXVII and the provisions of that Part relating to appeals apply to appeals under this subsection.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than 10 years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who
paragraphText: adds anything to, removes anything from or tampers with a sample or material that has been taken or is being or is about to be taken from any existing or prospective mine, mining claim or oil well for the purpose of being assayed, tested or otherwise valued, with a fraudulent intent to affect the result of the assay, test or valuation.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than 10 years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who
paragraphText: adds anything to or removes anything from any existing or prospective mine, mining claim or oil well with a fraudulent intent to affect the result of an assay, a test or a valuation that has been made or is to be made with respect to the mine, mining claim or oil well, or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: For the purposes of proceedings under subsection (1), evidence that
paragraphText: something has been added to or removed from anything to which subsection (1) applies, or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: For the purposes of proceedings under subsection (1), evidence that
paragraphText: anything to which subsection (1) applies has been tampered with,

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Everyone commits an offence who, by deceit, falsehood or other fraudulent means, knowingly obtains a trade secret or communicates or makes available a trade secret.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Everyone commits an offence who knowingly obtains a trade secret or communicates or makes available a trade secret knowing that it was obtained by the commission of an offence under subsection (1).

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Everyone who commits an offence referred to in subsection (1) or (2) is guilty
paragraphText: of an indictable offence and is liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding 14 years; or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Everyone who commits an offence referred to in subsection (1) or (2) is guilty
paragraphText: of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: For greater certainty, no person commits an offence under subsection (1) or (2) if the trade secret was obtained by independent development or by reason only of reverse engineering.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: For the purpose of this section, trade secret means any information that
paragraphText: is not generally known in the trade or business that uses or may use that information;

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: For the purpose of this section, trade secret means any information that
paragraphText: has economic value from not being generally known; and

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: For the purpose of this section, trade secret means any information that
paragraphText: is the subject of efforts that are reasonable under the circumstances to maintain its secrecy.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
sectiontext: [Repealed, 2015, c. 13, s. 11]

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
sectiontext: [Repealed, 2015, c. 13, s. 11]

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every person who, with intent to defraud their creditors, is privy to the commission of an offence under subsection (1) is guilty of
paragraphText: an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years; or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every person who, with intent to defraud their creditors, is privy to the commission of an offence under subsection (1) is guilty of
paragraphText: an offence punishable on summary conviction.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who, with intent to defraud,
paragraphText: destroys, mutilates, alters, falsifies or makes a false entry in a book, paper, writing, valuable security or document, or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who, with intent to defraud,
paragraphText: omits a material particular from, or alters a material particular in, a book, paper, writing, valuable security or document.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
sectiontext: Every one who, with intent to deceive, falsifies an employment record by any means, including the punching of a time clock, is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
sectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who, being entrusted with the receipt, custody or management of any part of the public revenues, knowingly furnishes a false statement or return of

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than 10 years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who makes, circulates or publishes a prospectus, a statement or an account, whether written or oral, that they know is false in a material particular, with intent
paragraphText: to induce persons, whether ascertained or not, to become shareholders or partners in a company,

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than 10 years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who makes, circulates or publishes a prospectus, a statement or an account, whether written or oral, that they know is false in a material particular, with intent
paragraphText: to deceive or defraud the members, shareholders or creditors, whether ascertained or not, of a company, or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than 10 years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who makes, circulates or publishes a prospectus, a statement or an account, whether written or oral, that they know is false in a material particular, with intent
paragraphText: to induce any person to
subparagraphText: enter into any security for the benefit of a company.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than 10 years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who makes, circulates or publishes a prospectus, a statement or an account, whether written or oral, that they know is false in a material particular, with intent
paragraphText: to induce any person to
subparagraphText: entrust or advance anything to a company, or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than 10 years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who makes, circulates or publishes a prospectus, a statement or an account, whether written or oral, that they know is false in a material particular, with intent
paragraphText: [Repealed, 1994, c. 44, s. 26]

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: In this section, company means a syndicate, body corporate or company, whether existing or proposed to be created.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every one who, by means of a false or misleading representation, knowingly obtains or attempts to obtain the carriage of anything by any person into a country, province, district or other place, whether or not within Canada, where the importation or transportation of it is, in the circumstances of the case, unlawful is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Where a person is convicted of an offence under subsection (1), anything by means of or in relation to which the offence was committed, on such conviction, in addition to any punishment that is imposed, is forfeited to Her Majesty and shall be disposed of as the court may direct.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
sectiontext: [Repealed, 2018, c. 29, s. 44]

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
sectiontext: Every person who, without lawful authority or excuse, acknowledges, in the name of another person before a court or a judge or other person authorized to receive the acknowledgment, a recognizance, undertaking, release order, confession of judgment, consent to judgment or judgment, deed or other instrument or act is guilty of

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
sectiontext: For the purposes of sections 402.2 and 403, identity information means any information — including biological or physiological information — of a type that is commonly used alone or in combination with other information to identify or purport to identify an individual, including a fingerprint, voice print, retina image, iris image, DNA profile, name, address, date of birth, written signature, electronic signature, digital signature, user name, credit card number, debit card number, financial institution account number, passport number, Social Insurance Number, health insurance number, driver’s licence number or password.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every person commits an offence who obtains or possesses another person’s identity information with intent to use it to commit an indictable offence that includes fraud, deceit or falsehood as an element of the offence.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Everyone commits an offence who transmits, makes available, distributes, sells or offers for sale another person’s identity information, or has it in their possession for any of those purposes, knowing that or being reckless as to whether the information will be used to commit an indictable offence that includes fraud, deceit or falsehood as an element of the offence.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: For the purposes of subsections (1) and (2), an indictable offence referred to in either of those subsections includes an offence under any of the following sections:
paragraphText: section 57 (forgery of or uttering forged passport);

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: For the purposes of subsections (1) and (2), an indictable offence referred to in either of those subsections includes an offence under any of the following sections:
paragraphText: section 58 (fraudulent use of certificate of citizenship);

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: For the purposes of subsections (1) and (2), an indictable offence referred to in either of those subsections includes an offence under any of the following sections:
paragraphText: section 130 (personating peace officer);

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: For the purposes of subsections (1) and (2), an indictable offence referred to in either of those subsections includes an offence under any of the following sections:
paragraphText: section 131 (perjury);

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: For the purposes of subsections (1) and (2), an indictable offence referred to in either of those subsections includes an offence under any of the following sections:
paragraphText: section 342 (theft, forgery, etc., of credit card);

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: For the purposes of subsections (1) and (2), an indictable offence referred to in either of those subsections includes an offence under any of the following sections:
paragraphText: section 362 (false pretence or false statement);

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: For the purposes of subsections (1) and (2), an indictable offence referred to in either of those subsections includes an offence under any of the following sections:
paragraphText: section 366 (forgery);

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: For the purposes of subsections (1) and (2), an indictable offence referred to in either of those subsections includes an offence under any of the following sections:
paragraphText: section 368 (use, trafficking or possession of forged document);

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: For the purposes of subsections (1) and (2), an indictable offence referred to in either of those subsections includes an offence under any of the following sections:
paragraphText: section 380 (fraud); and

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: For the purposes of subsections (1) and (2), an indictable offence referred to in either of those subsections includes an offence under any of the following sections:
paragraphText: section 403 (identity fraud).

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: An accused who is charged with an offence under subsection (1) or (2) may be tried and punished by any court having jurisdiction to try that offence in the place where the offence is alleged to have been committed or in the place where the accused is found, is arrested or is in custody. However, no proceeding in respect of the offence shall be commenced in a province without the consent of the Attorney General of that province if the offence is alleged to have been committed outside that province.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Everyone who commits an offence under subsection (1) or (2)
paragraphText: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years; or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Everyone who commits an offence under subsection (1) or (2)
paragraphText: is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Everyone commits an offence who fraudulently personates another person, living or dead,
paragraphText: with intent to gain advantage for themselves or another person;

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Everyone commits an offence who fraudulently personates another person, living or dead,
paragraphText: with intent to obtain any property or an interest in any property;

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Everyone commits an offence who fraudulently personates another person, living or dead,
paragraphText: with intent to cause disadvantage to the person being personated or another person; or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Everyone commits an offence who fraudulently personates another person, living or dead,
paragraphText: with intent to avoid arrest or prosecution or to obstruct, pervert or defeat the course of justice.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: For the purposes of subsection (1), personating a person includes pretending to be the person or using the person’s identity information — whether by itself or in combination with identity information pertaining to any person — as if it pertains to the person using it.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Everyone who commits an offence under subsection (1)
paragraphText: is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than 10 years; or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Everyone who commits an offence under subsection (1)
paragraphText: is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
sectiontext: [Repealed, 2018, c. 29, s. 46]

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
sectiontext: Every one who

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
sectiontext: The Governor in Council may, by notice to be published in the Canada Gazette, prescribe distinguishing marks that are appropriated for use on public stores to denote the property of Her Majesty therein, whether the stores belong to Her Majesty in right of Canada or to Her Majesty in any other right.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Applying or removing marks without authority
subsectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than two years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who,
paragraphText: without lawful authority applies a distinguishing mark to anything, or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Applying or removing marks without authority
subsectiontext: Every person is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than two years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who,
paragraphText: with intent to conceal the property of Her Majesty in public stores, removes, destroys or obliterates, in whole or in part, a distinguishing mark.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Applying or removing marks without authority
subsectiontext: Every person who, without lawful authority, receives, possesses, keeps, sells or delivers public stores that they know bear a distinguishing mark is guilty of
paragraphText: an indictable offence and is liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years; or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Applying or removing marks without authority
subsectiontext: Every person who, without lawful authority, receives, possesses, keeps, sells or delivers public stores that they know bear a distinguishing mark is guilty of
paragraphText: an offence punishable on summary conviction.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Applying or removing marks without authority
subsectiontext: For the purposes of this section, distinguishing mark means a distinguishing mark that is appropriated for use on public stores pursuant to section 416.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Selling defective stores to Her Majesty
subsectiontext: Every one who knowingly sells or delivers defective stores to Her Majesty or commits fraud in connection with the sale, lease or delivery of stores to Her Majesty or the manufacture of stores for Her Majesty is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding fourteen years.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Selling defective stores to Her Majesty
subsectiontext: Every one who, being a representative of an organization that commits, by fraud, an offence under subsection (1),
paragraphText: knowingly takes part in the fraud, or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Selling defective stores to Her Majesty
subsectiontext: Every one who, being a representative of an organization that commits, by fraud, an offence under subsection (1),
paragraphText: knows or has reason to suspect that the fraud is being committed or has been or is about to be committed and does not inform the responsible government, or a department thereof, of Her Majesty,

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
marginalnotetext_x: Unlawful use of military uniforms or certificates
sectiontext: Every person is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who, without lawful authority,

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every one who buys, receives or detains from a member of the Canadian Forces or a deserter or an absentee without leave therefrom any military stores that are owned by Her Majesty or for which the member, deserter or absentee without leave is accountable to Her Majesty is guilty of
paragraphText: an indictable offence and is liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years; or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every one who buys, receives or detains from a member of the Canadian Forces or a deserter or an absentee without leave therefrom any military stores that are owned by Her Majesty or for which the member, deserter or absentee without leave is accountable to Her Majesty is guilty of
paragraphText: an offence punishable on summary conviction.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: No person shall be convicted of an offence under this section where he establishes that he did not know and had no reason to suspect that the military stores in respect of which the offence was committed were owned by Her Majesty or were military stores for which the member, deserter or absentee without leave was accountable to Her Majesty.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: In proceedings under sections 417 to 420, evidence that a person was at any time performing duties in the Canadian Forces is, in the absence of any evidence to the contrary, proof that his enrolment in the Canadian Forces prior to that time was regular.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: An accused who is charged with an offence under subsection 417(2) shall be presumed to have known that the stores in respect of which the offence is alleged to have been committed bore a distinguishing mark within the meaning of that subsection at the time the offence is alleged to have been committed if he was, at that time, in the service or employment of Her Majesty or was a dealer in marine stores or in old metals.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
sectiontext: Every person who threatens to commit an offence under section 235, 236, 266, 267, 268, 269, 269.1, 271, 272, 273, 279 or 279.1 against an internationally protected person or who threatens to commit an offence under section 431 is guilty of

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
marginalnotetext_x: Threat against United Nations or associated personnel
sectiontext: Every person who, with intent to compel any person, group of persons, state or any international or intergovernmental organization to do or refrain from doing any act, threatens to commit an offence under section 235, 236, 266, 267, 268, 269, 269.1, 271, 272, 273, 279 or 279.1 against a member of United Nations personnel or associated personnel or threatens to commit an offence under section 431.1 is guilty of

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: Every one who wilfully breaks a contract, knowing or having reasonable cause to believe that the probable consequences of doing so, whether alone or in combination with others, will be
paragraphText: to endanger human life,

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: Every one who wilfully breaks a contract, knowing or having reasonable cause to believe that the probable consequences of doing so, whether alone or in combination with others, will be
paragraphText: to cause serious bodily injury,

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: Every one who wilfully breaks a contract, knowing or having reasonable cause to believe that the probable consequences of doing so, whether alone or in combination with others, will be
paragraphText: to expose valuable property, real or personal, to destruction or serious injury,

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: Every one who wilfully breaks a contract, knowing or having reasonable cause to believe that the probable consequences of doing so, whether alone or in combination with others, will be
paragraphText: to deprive the inhabitants of a city or place, or part thereof, wholly or to a great extent, of their supply of light, power, gas or water, or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: Every one who wilfully breaks a contract, knowing or having reasonable cause to believe that the probable consequences of doing so, whether alone or in combination with others, will be
paragraphText: to delay or prevent the running of any locomotive engine, tender, freight or passenger train or car, on a railway that is a common carrier,

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: Every one who wilfully breaks a contract, knowing or having reasonable cause to believe that the probable consequences of doing so, whether alone or in combination with others, will be
paragraphText: an indictable offence and is liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years, or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: Every one who wilfully breaks a contract, knowing or having reasonable cause to believe that the probable consequences of doing so, whether alone or in combination with others, will be
paragraphText: an offence punishable on summary conviction.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: No person wilfully breaks a contract within the meaning of subsection (1) by reason only that
paragraphText: being the employee of an employer, he stops work as a result of the failure of his employer and himself to agree on any matter relating to his employment, or,

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: No person wilfully breaks a contract within the meaning of subsection (1) by reason only that
paragraphText: being a member of an organization of employees formed for the purpose of regulating relations between employers and employees, he stops work as a result of the failure of the employer and a bargaining agent acting on behalf of the organization to agree on any matter relating to the employment of members of the organization,

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: No proceedings shall be instituted under this section without the consent of the Attorney General.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: Every one is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who, wrongfully and without lawful authority, for the purpose of compelling another person to abstain from doing anything that he or she has a lawful right to do, or to do anything that he or she has a lawful right to abstain from doing,
paragraphText: uses violence or threats of violence to that person or their intimate partner or children, or injures the person’s property;

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: Every one is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who, wrongfully and without lawful authority, for the purpose of compelling another person to abstain from doing anything that he or she has a lawful right to do, or to do anything that he or she has a lawful right to abstain from doing,
paragraphText: intimidates or attempts to intimidate that person or a relative of that person by threats that, in Canada or elsewhere, violence or other injury will be done to or punishment inflicted on him or her or a relative of his or hers, or that the property of any of them will be damaged;

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: Every one is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who, wrongfully and without lawful authority, for the purpose of compelling another person to abstain from doing anything that he or she has a lawful right to do, or to do anything that he or she has a lawful right to abstain from doing,
paragraphText: persistently follows that person;

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: Every one is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who, wrongfully and without lawful authority, for the purpose of compelling another person to abstain from doing anything that he or she has a lawful right to do, or to do anything that he or she has a lawful right to abstain from doing,
paragraphText: hides any tools, clothes or other property owned or used by that person, or deprives him or her of them or hinders him or her in the use of them;

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: Every one is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who, wrongfully and without lawful authority, for the purpose of compelling another person to abstain from doing anything that he or she has a lawful right to do, or to do anything that he or she has a lawful right to abstain from doing,
paragraphText: with one or more other persons, follows that person, in a disorderly manner, on a highway;

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: Every one is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who, wrongfully and without lawful authority, for the purpose of compelling another person to abstain from doing anything that he or she has a lawful right to do, or to do anything that he or she has a lawful right to abstain from doing,
paragraphText: besets or watches the place where that person resides, works, carries on business or happens to be; or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: Every one is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years or is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who, wrongfully and without lawful authority, for the purpose of compelling another person to abstain from doing anything that he or she has a lawful right to do, or to do anything that he or she has a lawful right to abstain from doing,
paragraphText: blocks or obstructs a highway.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: A person who attends at or near or approaches a dwelling-house or place, for the purpose only of obtaining or communicating information, does not watch or beset within the meaning of this section.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
marginalnotetext_x: Intimidation of a justice system participant or a journalist
subsectiontext: No person shall, without lawful authority, engage in any conduct with the intent to provoke a state of fear in
paragraphText: a group of persons or the general public in order to impede the administration of criminal justice;

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
marginalnotetext_x: Intimidation of a justice system participant or a journalist
subsectiontext: No person shall, without lawful authority, engage in any conduct with the intent to provoke a state of fear in
paragraphText: a journalist in order to impede him or her in the transmission to the public of information in relation to a criminal organization.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
marginalnotetext_x: Intimidation of a justice system participant or a journalist
subsectiontext: No person shall, without lawful authority, engage in any conduct with the intent to provoke a state of fear in
paragraphText: a justice system participant or military justice system participant in order to impede him or her in the performance of his or her duties; or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
marginalnotetext_x: Intimidation of a justice system participant or a journalist
subsectiontext: [Repealed, 2015, c. 13, s. 12]

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
marginalnotetext_x: Intimidation of a justice system participant or a journalist
subsectiontext: Every person who contravenes this section is guilty of an indictable offence and is liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than fourteen years.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
marginalnotetext_x: Intimidation of a justice system participant or a journalist
subsectiontext: In this section, military justice system participant has the same meaning as in subsection 2(1) of the National Defence Act.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
sectiontext: Every one who, being an employer or the agent of an employer, wrongfully and without lawful authority

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: No employer or person acting on behalf of an employer or in a position of authority in respect of an employee of the employer shall take a disciplinary measure against, demote, terminate or otherwise adversely affect the employment of such an employee, or threaten to do so,
paragraphText: with the intent to compel the employee to abstain from providing information to a person whose duties include the enforcement of federal or provincial law, respecting an offence that the employee believes has been or is being committed contrary to this or any other federal or provincial Act or regulation by the employer or an officer or employee of the employer or, if the employer is a corporation, by one or more of its directors; or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: No employer or person acting on behalf of an employer or in a position of authority in respect of an employee of the employer shall take a disciplinary measure against, demote, terminate or otherwise adversely affect the employment of such an employee, or threaten to do so,
paragraphText: with the intent to retaliate against the employee because the employee has provided information referred to in paragraph (a) to a person whose duties include the enforcement of federal or provincial law.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: Any one who contravenes subsection (1) is guilty of
paragraphText: an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years; or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: Any one who contravenes subsection (1) is guilty of
paragraphText: an offence punishable on summary conviction.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: Every person commits an offence who engages in any conduct with the intent to provoke a state of fear in
paragraphText: a person in order to impede them from obtaining health services from a health professional;

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: Every person commits an offence who engages in any conduct with the intent to provoke a state of fear in
paragraphText: a health professional in order to impede them in the performance of their duties; or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: Every person commits an offence who engages in any conduct with the intent to provoke a state of fear in
paragraphText: a person, whose functions are to assist a health professional in the performance of the health professional’s duties, in order to impede that person in the performance of those functions.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: Every person commits an offence who, without lawful authority, intentionally obstructs or interferes with another person’s lawful access to a place at which health services are provided by a health professional.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: Every person who commits an offence under subsection (1) or (2) is
paragraphText: guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than 10 years; or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: Every person who commits an offence under subsection (1) or (2) is
paragraphText: guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: No person is guilty of an offence under subsection (2) by reason only that they attend at or near, or approach, a place referred to in that subsection for the purpose only of obtaining or communicating information.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
heading2titletext: Breach of Contract, Intimidation and Discrimination Against Trade Unionists
subsectiontext: In this section, health professional means a person who is entitled under the laws of a province to provide health services.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: A person who commits an offence under this section is guilty of
paragraphText: an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for a term of not more than five years; or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: A person who commits an offence under this section is guilty of
paragraphText: an offence punishable on summary conviction.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every one commits an offence who
paragraphText: directly or indirectly, corruptly gives, offers or agrees to give or offer to an agent or to anyone for the benefit of the agent — or, being an agent, directly or indirectly, corruptly demands, accepts or offers or agrees to accept from any person, for themselves or another person — any reward, advantage or benefit of any kind as consideration for doing or not doing, or for having done or not done, any act relating to the affairs or business of the agent’s principal, or for showing or not showing favour or disfavour to any person with relation to the affairs or business of the agent’s principal; or

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every one commits an offence who
paragraphText: with intent to deceive a principal, gives to an agent of that principal, or, being an agent, uses with intent to deceive his principal, a receipt, an account or other writing
subparagraphText: in which the principal has an interest,

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every one commits an offence who
paragraphText: with intent to deceive a principal, gives to an agent of that principal, or, being an agent, uses with intent to deceive his principal, a receipt, an account or other writing
subparagraphText: that contains any statement that is false or erroneous or defective in any material particular, and

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every one commits an offence who
paragraphText: with intent to deceive a principal, gives to an agent of that principal, or, being an agent, uses with intent to deceive his principal, a receipt, an account or other writing
subparagraphText: that is intended to mislead the principal.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: Every one commits an offence who is knowingly privy to the commission of an offence under subsection (1).

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
subsectiontext: In this section, agent includes an employee, and principal includes an employer.

heading1titletext: Fraudulent Transactions Relating to Contracts and Trade
sectiontext: [Repealed, 2018, c. 29, s. 50]

heading1titletext: Wilful and Forbidden Acts in Respect of Certain Property
sectiontext: In this Part, property means real or personal corporeal property.

heading1titletext: Wilful and Forbidden Acts in Respect of Certain Property
subsectiontext: Every one who causes the occurrence of an event by doing an act or by omitting to do an act that it is his duty to do, knowing that the act or omission will probably cause the occurrence of the event and being reckless whether the event occurs or not, shall be deemed, for the purposes of this Part, wilfully to have caused the occurrence of the event.

heading1titletext: Wilful and Forbidden Acts in Respect of Certain Property
subsectiontext: A person shall not be convicted of an offence under sections 430 to 446 if they act with legal justification or excuse or colour of right.

heading1titletext: Wilful and Forbidden Acts in Respect of Certain Property
subsectiontext: Where it is an offence to destroy or to damage anything,
paragraphText: the fact that a person has a partial interest in what is destroyed or damaged does not prevent him from being guilty of the offence if he caused the destruction or damage; and

heading1titletext: Wilful and Forbidden Acts in Respect of Certain Property
subsectiontext: Where it is an offence to destroy or to damage anything,
paragraphText: the fact that a person has a total interest in what is destroyed or damaged does not prevent him from being guilty of the offence if he caused the destruction or damage with intent to defraud.

heading1titletext: Wilful and Forbidden Acts in Respect of Certain Property
subsectiontext: Every one commits mischief who wilfully
paragraphText: destroys or damages property;

heading1titletext: Wilful and Forbidden Acts in Respect of Certain Property
subsectiontext: Every one commits mischief who wilfully
paragraphText: renders property dangerous, useless, inoperative or ineffective;

heading1titletext: Wilful and Forbidden Acts in Respect of Certain Property
subsectiontext: Every one commits mischief who wilfully
paragraphText: obstructs, interrupts or interferes with the lawful use, enjoyment or operation of property; or

heading1titletext: Wilful and Forbidden Acts in Respect of Certain Property
subsectiontext: Every one commits mischief who wilfully
paragraphText: obstructs, interrupts or interferes with any person in the lawful use, enjoyment or operation of property.

heading1titletext: Wilful and Forbidden Acts in Respect of Certain Property
subsectiontext: Everyone commits mischief who wilfully
marginalnotetext_y: Mischief in relation to computer data
paragraphText: destroys or alters computer data;

heading1titletext: Wilful and Forbidden Acts in Respect of Certain Property
subsectiontext: Everyone commits mischief who wilfully
marginalnotetext_y: Mischief in relation to computer data
paragraphText: renders computer data meaningless, useless or ineffective;

heading1titletext: Wilful and Forbidden Acts in Respect of Certain Property
subsectiontext: Everyone commits mischief who wilfully
marginalnotetext_y: Mischief in relation to computer data
paragraphText: obstructs, interrupts or interferes with the lawful use of computer data; or

heading1titletext: Wilful and Forbidden Acts in Respect of Certain Property
subsectiontext: Everyone commits mischief who wilfully
marginalnotetext_y: Mischief in relation to computer data
paragraphText: obstructs, interrupts or interferes with a person in the lawful use of computer data or denies access to computer data to a person who is entitled to access to it.

heading1titletext: Wilful and Forbidden Acts in Respect of Certain Property
subsectiontext: Every one who commits mischief that causes actual danger to life is guilty of an indictable offence and liable to imprisonment for life.

heading1titletext: Wilful and Forbidden Acts in Respect of Certain Property
