subsectiontext: The peace officer shall not release the person if the peace officer believes, on reasonable grounds,
paragraphText: that it is necessary in the public interest that the person be detained in custody or that the matter of their release from custody be dealt with under another provision of this Part, having regard to all the circumstances including the need to
subparagraphText: prevent the continuation or repetition of the offence or the commission of another offence, or

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
heading2titletext: Arrest without Warrant and Release from Custody
marginalnotetext_x: Release from custody — arrest without warrant
subsectiontext: The peace officer shall not release the person if the peace officer believes, on reasonable grounds,
paragraphText: that it is necessary in the public interest that the person be detained in custody or that the matter of their release from custody be dealt with under another provision of this Part, having regard to all the circumstances including the need to
subparagraphText: ensure the safety and security of any victim of or witness to the offence; or

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
heading2titletext: Arrest without Warrant and Release from Custody
marginalnotetext_x: Release from custody — arrest without warrant
subsectiontext: The peace officer shall not release the person if the peace officer believes, on reasonable grounds,
paragraphText: that, if the person is released from custody, the person will fail to attend court in order to be dealt with according to law.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
heading2titletext: Arrest without Warrant and Release from Custody
marginalnotetext_x: Release from custody — arrest without warrant
subsectiontext: A peace officer who has arrested a person without a warrant, or who has been given the custody of a person arrested without a warrant, for an offence described in subsection (1), and who does not release the person from custody as soon as practicable in the manner described in that subsection shall be deemed to be acting lawfully and in the execution of the officer’s duty for the purposes of
paragraphText: any other proceedings, unless in any such proceedings it is alleged and established by the person making the allegation that the peace officer did not comply with the requirements of subsection (1).

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
heading2titletext: Arrest without Warrant and Release from Custody
marginalnotetext_x: Release from custody — arrest without warrant
subsectiontext: A peace officer who has arrested a person without a warrant, or who has been given the custody of a person arrested without a warrant, for an offence described in subsection (1), and who does not release the person from custody as soon as practicable in the manner described in that subsection shall be deemed to be acting lawfully and in the execution of the officer’s duty for the purposes of
paragraphText: any proceedings under this or any other Act of Parliament; or

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Except as otherwise provided in this Part, an accused who is required to appear in a proceeding under this Part shall appear personally but may appear by audioconference or videoconference, if arrangements are made with the court in advance and those arrangements are satisfactory to the justice.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Despite section 714.1, a witness in Canada who is required to give evidence in a proceeding under this Part may do so by audioconference or videoconference, if it is satisfactory to the justice.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: For greater certainty, sections 714.2 to 714.8 apply when a witness outside Canada gives evidence in a proceeding under this Part.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: A participant, as defined in subsection 715.25(1), who is to participate in a proceeding under this Part shall participate personally but may participate by audioconference or videoconference, if it is satisfactory to the justice.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: The justice who is to preside at a proceeding under this Part shall preside personally but may preside by audioconference or videoconference, if the justice considers it necessary in the circumstances.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Subject to the other provisions of this section, a peace officer who arrests a person with or without warrant and who has not released the person under any other provision under this Part shall, in accordance with the following paragraphs, cause the person to be taken before a justice to be dealt with according to law:
paragraphText: if a justice is available within a period of 24 hours after the person has been arrested by the peace officer, the person shall be taken before a justice without unreasonable delay and in any event within that period; and

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Subject to the other provisions of this section, a peace officer who arrests a person with or without warrant and who has not released the person under any other provision under this Part shall, in accordance with the following paragraphs, cause the person to be taken before a justice to be dealt with according to law:
paragraphText: if a justice is not available within a period of 24 hours after the person has been arrested by the peace officer, the person shall be taken before a justice as soon as possible.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: At any time before the expiry of the time referred to in paragraph (1)(a) or (b), a peace officer who is satisfied that the continued detention of the person in custody for an offence that is not listed in section 469 is no longer necessary shall release the person, if
paragraphText: the peace officer issues an appearance notice to the person; or

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: At any time before the expiry of the time referred to in paragraph (1)(a) or (b), a peace officer who is satisfied that the continued detention of the person in custody for an offence that is not listed in section 469 is no longer necessary shall release the person, if
paragraphText: the person gives an undertaking to the peace officer.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Subsections (1) and (1.1) also apply to a peace officer to whom a person is delivered under subsection 494(3) or into whose custody a person is placed under subsection 163.5(3) of the Customs Act, except that the 24-hour period referred to in paragraphs (1)(a) and (b) begins after the person is delivered to the officer.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: A peace officer having the custody of a person who has been arrested without warrant as a person about to commit an indictable offence shall release that person as soon as practicable after the officer is satisfied that the continued detention of that person is no longer necessary in order to prevent that person from committing an indictable offence.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Where a person has been arrested without warrant for an indictable offence alleged to have been committed in Canada outside the territorial division where the arrest took place, the person shall, within the time prescribed in paragraph (1)(a) or (b), be taken before a justice within whose jurisdiction the person was arrested unless, where the offence was alleged to have been committed within the province in which the person was arrested, the person was taken before a justice within whose jurisdiction the offence was alleged to have been committed, and the justice within whose jurisdiction the person was arrested
marginalnotetext_y: Remand in custody for return to jurisdiction where offence alleged to have been committed
paragraphText: if the justice is not satisfied that there are reasonable grounds to believe that the person arrested is the person alleged to have committed the offence, shall release that person; or

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Where a person has been arrested without warrant for an indictable offence alleged to have been committed in Canada outside the territorial division where the arrest took place, the person shall, within the time prescribed in paragraph (1)(a) or (b), be taken before a justice within whose jurisdiction the person was arrested unless, where the offence was alleged to have been committed within the province in which the person was arrested, the person was taken before a justice within whose jurisdiction the offence was alleged to have been committed, and the justice within whose jurisdiction the person was arrested
marginalnotetext_y: Remand in custody for return to jurisdiction where offence alleged to have been committed
paragraphText: if the justice is satisfied that there are reasonable grounds to believe that the person arrested is the person alleged to have committed the offence, may
subparagraphText: remand the person to the custody of a peace officer to await execution of a warrant for his or her arrest in accordance with section 528, but if no warrant is so executed within a period of six days after the time he or she is remanded to such custody, the person in whose custody he or she then is shall release him or her, or

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Where a person has been arrested without warrant for an indictable offence alleged to have been committed in Canada outside the territorial division where the arrest took place, the person shall, within the time prescribed in paragraph (1)(a) or (b), be taken before a justice within whose jurisdiction the person was arrested unless, where the offence was alleged to have been committed within the province in which the person was arrested, the person was taken before a justice within whose jurisdiction the offence was alleged to have been committed, and the justice within whose jurisdiction the person was arrested
marginalnotetext_y: Remand in custody for return to jurisdiction where offence alleged to have been committed
paragraphText: if the justice is satisfied that there are reasonable grounds to believe that the person arrested is the person alleged to have committed the offence, may
subparagraphText: where the offence was alleged to have been committed within the province in which the person was arrested, order the person to be taken before a justice having jurisdiction with respect to the offence.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Notwithstanding paragraph (3)(b), a justice may, with the consent of the prosecutor, order that the person referred to in subsection (3), pending the execution of a warrant for the arrest of that person, be released
paragraphText: without conditions; or

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Notwithstanding paragraph (3)(b), a justice may, with the consent of the prosecutor, order that the person referred to in subsection (3), pending the execution of a warrant for the arrest of that person, be released
paragraphText: on the terms of a release order containing any conditions referred to in paragraphs 515(2)(a) to (e) that the justice considers desirable and to which the prosecutor consents.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Despite subsection (4), a peace officer having the custody of a person referred to in that subsection who does not release the person before the expiry of the time prescribed in paragraph (1)(a) or (b) for taking the person before the justice shall be deemed to be acting lawfully and in the execution of the peace officer’s duty for the purposes of
paragraphText: any other proceedings, unless in those proceedings it is alleged and established by the person making the allegation that the peace officer did not comply with the requirements of subsection (4).

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Despite subsection (4), a peace officer having the custody of a person referred to in that subsection who does not release the person before the expiry of the time prescribed in paragraph (1)(a) or (b) for taking the person before the justice shall be deemed to be acting lawfully and in the execution of the peace officer’s duty for the purposes of
paragraphText: any proceedings under this or any other Act of Parliament; or

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Time within which information to be laid in certain cases
sectiontext: If an appearance notice has been issued to an accused under section 497, or if an accused has been released from custody under section 498 or 503, an information relating to the offence alleged to have been committed by the accused or relating to an included or other offence alleged to have been committed by them shall be laid before a justice as soon as practicable after the issuance or release, and in any event before the time stated in the appearance notice or undertaking for their attendance in court.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Arrest warrant — failure to appear under summons
sectiontext: If an accused who is required by a summons to appear at the time and place stated in it for the purposes of the Identification of Criminals Act does not appear at that time and place and, in the case of an offence designated as a contravention under the Contraventions Act, the Attorney General, within the meaning of that Act, has not made an election under section 50 of that Act, a justice may issue a warrant for the arrest of the accused for the offence with which the accused is charged.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Arrest warrant — failure to appear under appearance notice or undertaking
sectiontext: If an accused who is required by an appearance notice or undertaking to appear at the time and place stated in it for the purposes of the Identification of Criminals Act does not appear at that time and place, a justice may, if the appearance notice or undertaking has been confirmed by a justice under section 508, issue a warrant for the arrest of the accused for the offence with which the accused is charged.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
sectiontext: If a justice is satisfied that there are reasonable grounds to believe that an accused has contravened or is about to contravene any summons, appearance notice, undertaking or release order that was issued or given to the accused or entered into by the accused or has committed an indictable offence while being subject to any summons, appearance notice, undertaking or release order, the justice may issue a warrant for the purpose of taking them before a justice under section 524.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: In what cases justice may receive information
sectiontext: Any one who, on reasonable grounds, believes that a person has committed an indictable offence may lay an information in writing and under oath before a justice, and the justice shall receive the information, where it is alleged

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
sectiontext: An information laid under section 504 or 505 may be in Form 2.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Justice to hear informant and witnesses — public prosecutions
subsectiontext: A justice who issues a warrant under this section or section 508, 512, 512.1 or 512.2 may, unless the offence is one listed in section 469, authorize the release of the accused under section 499 by making an endorsement on the warrant in Form 29.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Justice to hear informant and witnesses — public prosecutions
subsectiontext: If, under subsection (6), a justice authorizes the release of an accused under section 499, an appearance notice or undertaking referred to in that section shall be deemed, for the purposes of subsection 145(3) or (4), as the case may be, to have been confirmed by a justice under section 508.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Justice to hear informant and witnesses — public prosecutions
subsectiontext: Subject to subsection 523(1.1), a justice who receives an information laid under section 504 by a peace officer, a public officer, the Attorney General or the Attorney General’s agent, other than an information laid before the justice under section 505, shall, except if an accused has already been arrested with or without a warrant,
paragraphText: hear and consider, ex parte,
subparagraphText: the allegations of the informant, and

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Justice to hear informant and witnesses — public prosecutions
subsectiontext: Subject to subsection 523(1.1), a justice who receives an information laid under section 504 by a peace officer, a public officer, the Attorney General or the Attorney General’s agent, other than an information laid before the justice under section 505, shall, except if an accused has already been arrested with or without a warrant,
paragraphText: hear and consider, ex parte,
subparagraphText: the evidence of witnesses, where he considers it desirable or necessary to do so; and

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Justice to hear informant and witnesses — public prosecutions
subsectiontext: Subject to subsection 523(1.1), a justice who receives an information laid under section 504 by a peace officer, a public officer, the Attorney General or the Attorney General’s agent, other than an information laid before the justice under section 505, shall, except if an accused has already been arrested with or without a warrant,
paragraphText: where he considers that a case for so doing is made out, issue, in accordance with this section, either a summons or a warrant for the arrest of the accused to compel the accused to attend before him or some other justice for the same territorial division to answer to a charge of an offence.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Justice to hear informant and witnesses — public prosecutions
subsectiontext: No justice shall refuse to issue a summons or warrant by reason only that the alleged offence is one for which a person may be arrested without warrant.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Justice to hear informant and witnesses — public prosecutions
subsectiontext: A justice who hears the evidence of a witness pursuant to subsection (1) shall
paragraphText: take the evidence on oath; and

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Justice to hear informant and witnesses — public prosecutions
subsectiontext: A justice who hears the evidence of a witness pursuant to subsection (1) shall
paragraphText: cause the evidence to be taken in accordance with section 540 in so far as that section is capable of being applied.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Justice to hear informant and witnesses — public prosecutions
subsectiontext: Where a justice considers that a case is made out for compelling an accused to attend before him to answer to a charge of an offence, he shall issue a summons to the accused unless the allegations of the informant or the evidence of any witness or witnesses taken in accordance with subsection (3) discloses reasonable grounds to believe that it is necessary in the public interest to issue a warrant for the arrest of the accused.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Justice to hear informant and witnesses — public prosecutions
subsectiontext: A justice shall not sign a summons or warrant in blank.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Justice to hear informant and witnesses — public prosecutions
subsectiontext: Where, on an appeal from or review of any decision or matter of jurisdiction, a new trial or hearing or a continuance or renewal of a trial or hearing is ordered, a justice may issue either a summons or a warrant for the arrest of the accused in order to compel the accused to attend at the new or continued or renewed trial or hearing.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: A justice who receives an information laid under section 504, other than an information referred to in subsection 507(1), shall refer it to a provincial court judge or, in Quebec, a judge of the Court of Quebec, or to a designated justice, to consider whether to compel the appearance of the accused on the information.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: A judge or designated justice to whom an information is referred under subsection (1) and who considers that a case for doing so is made out shall issue either a summons or warrant for the arrest of the accused to compel him or her to attend before a justice to answer to a charge of the offence charged in the information.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: The judge or designated justice may issue a summons or warrant only if he or she
paragraphText: has heard and considered the allegations of the informant and the evidence of witnesses;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: The judge or designated justice may issue a summons or warrant only if he or she
paragraphText: is satisfied that the Attorney General has received a copy of the information;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: The judge or designated justice may issue a summons or warrant only if he or she
paragraphText: is satisfied that the Attorney General has received reasonable notice of the hearing under paragraph (a); and

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: The judge or designated justice may issue a summons or warrant only if he or she
paragraphText: has given the Attorney General an opportunity to attend the hearing under paragraph (a) and to cross-examine and call witnesses and to present any relevant evidence at the hearing.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: The Attorney General may appear at the hearing held under paragraph (3)(a) without being deemed to intervene in the proceeding.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: If the judge or designated justice does not issue a summons or warrant under subsection (2), he or she shall endorse the information with a statement to that effect. Unless the informant, not later than six months after the endorsement, commences proceedings to compel the judge or designated justice to issue a summons or warrant, the information is deemed never to have been laid.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: If proceedings are commenced under subsection (5) and a summons or warrant is not issued as a result of those proceedings, the information is deemed never to have been laid.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: If a hearing in respect of an offence has been held under paragraph (3)(a) and the judge or designated justice has not issued a summons or a warrant, no other hearings may be held under that paragraph with respect to the offence or an included offence unless there is new evidence in support of the allegation in respect of which the hearing is sought to be held.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Subsections 507(2) to (8) apply to proceedings under this section.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Subsections (1) to (8) do not apply in respect of an information laid under section 810 or 810.1.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: In this section, designated justice means a justice designated for the purpose by the chief judge of the provincial court having jurisdiction in the matter or, in Quebec, a justice designated by the chief judge of the Court of Quebec.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: In this section, Attorney General includes the Attorney General of Canada and his or her lawful deputy in respect of proceedings that could have been commenced at the instance of the Government of Canada and conducted by or on behalf of that Government.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Justice to hear informant and witnesses
subsectiontext: A justice who receives an information laid before him under section 505 shall
paragraphText: if the justice considers that a case for so doing is made out, whether the information relates to the offence alleged in the appearance notice or undertaking or to an included or other offence,
subparagraphText: confirm the appearance notice or undertaking and endorse the information accordingly, or

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Justice to hear informant and witnesses
subsectiontext: A justice who receives an information laid before him under section 505 shall
paragraphText: if the justice considers that a case for so doing is made out, whether the information relates to the offence alleged in the appearance notice or undertaking or to an included or other offence,
subparagraphText: cancel the appearance notice or undertaking and issue, in accordance with section 507, either a summons or a warrant for the arrest of the accused to compel the accused to attend before the justice or some other justice for the same territorial division to answer to a charge of an offence and endorse on the summons or warrant that the appearance notice or undertaking has been cancelled; and

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Justice to hear informant and witnesses
subsectiontext: A justice who receives an information laid before him under section 505 shall
paragraphText: if the justice considers that a case is not made out for the purposes of paragraph (b), cancel the appearance notice or undertaking and cause the accused to be immediately notified of the cancellation.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Justice to hear informant and witnesses
subsectiontext: A justice who receives an information laid before him under section 505 shall
paragraphText: hear and consider, ex parte,
subparagraphText: the allegations of the informant, and

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Justice to hear informant and witnesses
subsectiontext: A justice who receives an information laid before him under section 505 shall
paragraphText: hear and consider, ex parte,
subparagraphText: the evidence of witnesses, where he considers it desirable or necessary to do so;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Justice to hear informant and witnesses
subsectiontext: A justice who hears the evidence of a witness pursuant to subsection (1) shall
paragraphText: take the evidence on oath; and

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Justice to hear informant and witnesses
subsectiontext: A justice who hears the evidence of a witness pursuant to subsection (1) shall
paragraphText: cause the evidence to be taken in accordance with section 540 in so far as that section is capable of being applied.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Information laid otherwise than in person
subsectiontext: For the purposes of sections 504 to 508, a peace officer may lay an information by any means of telecommunication that produces a writing.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Information laid otherwise than in person
subsectiontext: A peace officer who uses a means of telecommunication referred to in subsection (1) shall, instead of swearing an oath, make a statement in writing stating that all matters contained in the information are true to the officer’s knowledge and belief, and such a statement is deemed to be a statement made under oath.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: The summons must set out a summary of subsection 145(3), section 512.1 and subsection 524(4).

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: A summons issued under this Part shall
paragraphText: be directed to the accused;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: A summons issued under this Part shall
paragraphText: set out briefly the offence in respect of which the accused is charged; and

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: A summons issued under this Part shall
paragraphText: require the accused to attend court at a time and place to be stated therein and to attend thereafter as required by the court in order to be dealt with according to law.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: A summons shall be served by a peace officer who shall deliver it personally to the person to whom it is directed or, if that person cannot conveniently be found, shall leave it for him at his latest or usual place of abode with an inmate thereof who appears to be at least sixteen years of age.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: [Repealed, 2008, c. 18, s. 17]

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: A summons may require the accused to appear at a time and place stated in it for the purposes of the Identification of Criminals Act, where the accused is alleged to have committed an indictable offence and, in the case of an offence designated as a contravention under the Contraventions Act, the Attorney General, within the meaning of that Act, has not made an election under section 50 of that Act.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: A warrant issued under this Part shall
paragraphText: name or describe the accused;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: A warrant issued under this Part shall
paragraphText: set out briefly the offence in respect of which the accused is charged; and

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: A warrant issued under this Part shall
paragraphText: order that the accused be forthwith arrested and brought before the judge or justice who issued the warrant or before some other judge or justice having jurisdiction in the same territorial division, to be dealt with according to law.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: A warrant issued under this Part remains in force until it is executed and need not be made returnable at any particular time.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Notwithstanding paragraph (1)(c), a judge or justice who issues a warrant may specify in the warrant the period before which the warrant shall not be executed, to allow the accused to appear voluntarily before a judge or justice having jurisdiction in the territorial division in which the warrant was issued.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Where the accused appears voluntarily for the offence in respect of which the accused is charged, the warrant is deemed to be executed.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Certain actions not to preclude issue of warrant
subsectiontext: A justice may, where the justice has reasonable and probable grounds to believe that it is necessary in the public interest to issue a summons or a warrant for the arrest of the accused, issue a summons or warrant, notwithstanding that
paragraphText: an appearance notice or undertaking has been confirmed or cancelled under subsection 508(1);

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Certain actions not to preclude issue of warrant
subsectiontext: A justice may, where the justice has reasonable and probable grounds to believe that it is necessary in the public interest to issue a summons or a warrant for the arrest of the accused, issue a summons or warrant, notwithstanding that
paragraphText: the accused has been released without conditions or with the intention of compelling their appearance by way of summons.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Certain actions not to preclude issue of warrant
subsectiontext: A justice may, where the justice has reasonable and probable grounds to believe that it is necessary in the public interest to issue a summons or a warrant for the arrest of the accused, issue a summons or warrant, notwithstanding that
paragraphText: a summons has previously been issued under subsection 507(4); or

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Certain actions not to preclude issue of warrant
subsectiontext: Where
paragraphText: an appearance notice or undertaking has been confirmed under subsection 508(1) and the accused fails to attend court in accordance with it in order to be dealt with according to law, or

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Certain actions not to preclude issue of warrant
subsectiontext: Where
paragraphText: service of a summons is proved and the accused fails to attend court in accordance with the summons,

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Certain actions not to preclude issue of warrant
subsectiontext: Where
paragraphText: it appears that a summons cannot be served because the accused is evading service,

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
sectiontext: A warrant in accordance with this Part shall be directed to the peace officers within the territorial jurisdiction of the justice, judge or court by whom or by which it is issued.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: A warrant in accordance with this Part may be executed by arresting the accused
paragraphText: wherever he is found within the territorial jurisdiction of the justice, judge or court by whom or by which the warrant was issued; or

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: A warrant in accordance with this Part may be executed by arresting the accused
paragraphText: wherever he is found in Canada, in the case of fresh pursuit.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: A warrant in accordance with this Part may be executed by a person who is one of the peace officers to whom it is directed, whether or not the place in which the warrant is to be executed is within the territory for which the person is a peace officer.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Before a judge, justice or court names a particular person as a surety, the person shall provide the judge, justice or court with a signed declaration under oath, solemn declaration or solemn affirmation in Form 12 that sets out
paragraphText: their name, date of birth and contact information;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Before a judge, justice or court names a particular person as a surety, the person shall provide the judge, justice or court with a signed declaration under oath, solemn declaration or solemn affirmation in Form 12 that sets out
paragraphText: information demonstrating that they are suitable to act as a surety for the accused, including financial information;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Before a judge, justice or court names a particular person as a surety, the person shall provide the judge, justice or court with a signed declaration under oath, solemn declaration or solemn affirmation in Form 12 that sets out
paragraphText: their relationship to the accused;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Before a judge, justice or court names a particular person as a surety, the person shall provide the judge, justice or court with a signed declaration under oath, solemn declaration or solemn affirmation in Form 12 that sets out
paragraphText: the name and date of birth of any other accused for whom they act as a surety;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Before a judge, justice or court names a particular person as a surety, the person shall provide the judge, justice or court with a signed declaration under oath, solemn declaration or solemn affirmation in Form 12 that sets out
paragraphText: their acknowledgment of the charge, and of any other outstanding charges against the accused and the contents of the accused’s criminal record, if any;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Before a judge, justice or court names a particular person as a surety, the person shall provide the judge, justice or court with a signed declaration under oath, solemn declaration or solemn affirmation in Form 12 that sets out
paragraphText: their acknowledgment of the amount that they are willing to promise to pay or deposit to the court and that may be forfeited if the accused fails to comply with any condition of the release order;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Before a judge, justice or court names a particular person as a surety, the person shall provide the judge, justice or court with a signed declaration under oath, solemn declaration or solemn affirmation in Form 12 that sets out
paragraphText: their acknowledgment that they understand the role and responsibilities of a surety and that they assume these voluntarily; and

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Before a judge, justice or court names a particular person as a surety, the person shall provide the judge, justice or court with a signed declaration under oath, solemn declaration or solemn affirmation in Form 12 that sets out
paragraphText: a description of the contents of their criminal record and any outstanding charges against them, if any.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Despite subsection (1), a judge, justice or court may name a person as a surety without a declaration if
paragraphText: the prosecutor consents to it; or

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Despite subsection (1), a judge, justice or court may name a person as a surety without a declaration if
paragraphText: the judge, justice or court is satisfied that
subparagraphText: the person cannot reasonably provide a declaration in the circumstances,

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Despite subsection (1), a judge, justice or court may name a person as a surety without a declaration if
paragraphText: the judge, justice or court is satisfied that
subparagraphText: the judge, justice or court has received sufficient information of the kind that would be set out in a declaration to evaluate whether the person is suitable to act as a surety for the accused, and

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Despite subsection (1), a judge, justice or court may name a person as a surety without a declaration if
paragraphText: the judge, justice or court is satisfied that
subparagraphText: the person has acknowleged that they have received sufficient information with respect to the matters referred to in paragraphs (1)(e) to (g) to accept the role and responsibilities of a surety.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: A person may provide the judge, justice or court with the declaration referred to in subsection (1) by a means of telecommunication that produces a writing.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Variation of release order with consent
sectiontext: A release order under which an accused has been released under section 515 may be varied with the written consent of the accused, prosecutor and any sureties. The order so varied is considered to be a release order under section 515.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: If, by this Act, the appearance of an accused is required for the purposes of judicial interim release, the accused shall appear personally but the justice may allow the accused to appear by videoconference or, subject to subsection (2.3), by audioconference, if the technological means is satisfactory to the justice.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: If the accused cannot appear by closed-circuit television or videoconference and the evidence of a witness is to be taken at the appearance, the consent of the prosecutor and the accused is required for the appearance of the accused by audioconference.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Subject to this section, when an accused who is charged with an offence other than an offence listed in section 469 is taken before a justice, the justice shall, unless a plea of guilty by the accused is accepted, make a release order in respect of that offence, without conditions, unless the prosecutor, having been given a reasonable opportunity to do so, shows cause, in respect of that offence, why the detention of the accused in custody is justified or why an order under any other provision of this section should be made.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: If the justice does not make an order under subsection (1), the justice shall, unless the prosecutor shows cause why the detention of the accused is justified, make a release order that sets out the conditions directed by the justice under subsection (4) and, as the case may be,
paragraphText: an indication that the release order does not include any financial obligations;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: If the justice does not make an order under subsection (1), the justice shall, unless the prosecutor shows cause why the detention of the accused is justified, make a release order that sets out the conditions directed by the justice under subsection (4) and, as the case may be,
paragraphText: the accused’s promise to pay a specified amount if they fail to comply with a condition of the order;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: If the justice does not make an order under subsection (1), the justice shall, unless the prosecutor shows cause why the detention of the accused is justified, make a release order that sets out the conditions directed by the justice under subsection (4) and, as the case may be,
paragraphText: the obligation to have one or more sureties, with or without the accused’s promise to pay a specified amount if they fail to comply with a condition of the order;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: If the justice does not make an order under subsection (1), the justice shall, unless the prosecutor shows cause why the detention of the accused is justified, make a release order that sets out the conditions directed by the justice under subsection (4) and, as the case may be,
paragraphText: the obligation to deposit money or other valuable security in a specified amount or value, with or without the accused’s promise to pay a specified amount if they fail to comply with a condition of the order; or

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: If the justice does not make an order under subsection (1), the justice shall, unless the prosecutor shows cause why the detention of the accused is justified, make a release order that sets out the conditions directed by the justice under subsection (4) and, as the case may be,
paragraphText: if the accused is not ordinarily resident in the province in which they are in custody or does not ordinarily reside within 200 kilometres of the place in which they are in custody, the obligation to deposit money or other valuable security in a specified amount or value, with or without the accused’s promise to pay a specified amount by the justice if they fail to comply with a condition of the order and with or without sureties.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: The justice shall not make an order containing the conditions referred to in one of the paragraphs (2)(b) to (e) unless the prosecution shows cause why an order containing the conditions referred to in the preceding paragraphs for any less onerous form of release would be inadequate.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: The justice shall favour a promise to pay an amount over the deposit of an amount of money if the accused or the surety, if applicable, has reasonably recoverable assets.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: For greater certainty, before making an order requiring that the accused have a surety, the justice shall be satisfied that this requirement is the least onerous form of release possible for the accused in the circumstances.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: If, under subsection (2) or any other provision of this Act, a judge, justice or court makes a release order with a requirement for sureties, the judge, justice or court may name particular persons as sureties.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: In making an order under this section, the justice shall consider any relevant factors, including,
paragraphText: whether the accused is charged with an offence in the commission of which violence was used, threatened or attempted against their intimate partner; or

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: In making an order under this section, the justice shall consider any relevant factors, including,
paragraphText: whether the accused has been previously convicted of a criminal offence.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: When making an order under subsection (2), the justice may direct the accused to comply with one or more of the following conditions specified in the order:
paragraphText: report at specified times to a peace officer, or other person, designated in the order;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: When making an order under subsection (2), the justice may direct the accused to comply with one or more of the following conditions specified in the order:
paragraphText: remain within a specified territorial jurisdiction;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: When making an order under subsection (2), the justice may direct the accused to comply with one or more of the following conditions specified in the order:
paragraphText: notify a peace officer or other person designated in the order of any change in their address, employment or occupation;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: When making an order under subsection (2), the justice may direct the accused to comply with one or more of the following conditions specified in the order:
paragraphText: abstain from communicating, directly or indirectly, with any victim, witness or other person identified in the order, except in accordance with any specified conditions that the justice considers necessary;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: When making an order under subsection (2), the justice may direct the accused to comply with one or more of the following conditions specified in the order:
paragraphText: abstain from going to any place or entering any geographic area specified in the order, except in accordance with any specified conditions that the justice considers necessary;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: When making an order under subsection (2), the justice may direct the accused to comply with one or more of the following conditions specified in the order:
paragraphText: deposit all their passports as specified in the order;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: When making an order under subsection (2), the justice may direct the accused to comply with one or more of the following conditions specified in the order:
paragraphText: comply with any other specified condition that the justice considers necessary to ensure the safety and security of any victim of or witness to the offence; and

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: When making an order under subsection (2), the justice may direct the accused to comply with one or more of the following conditions specified in the order:
paragraphText: comply with any other reasonable conditions specified in the order that the justice considers desirable.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: If an accused to whom subsection (6) applies shows cause why their detention in custody is not justified, the justice shall make a release order under this section. If the accused was already at large on a release order, the new release order may include any additional conditions described in subsections (4) to (4.2) that the justice considers desirable.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: When making an order under subsection (2), in the case of an accused who is charged with
marginalnotetext_y: Condition prohibiting possession of firearms, etc.
paragraphText: an offence in the commission of which violence against a person was used, threatened or attempted,

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: When making an order under subsection (2), in the case of an accused who is charged with
marginalnotetext_y: Condition prohibiting possession of firearms, etc.
paragraphText: a terrorism offence,

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: When making an order under subsection (2), in the case of an accused who is charged with
marginalnotetext_y: Condition prohibiting possession of firearms, etc.
paragraphText: an offence under section 264 (criminal harassment),

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: When making an order under subsection (2), in the case of an accused who is charged with
marginalnotetext_y: Condition prohibiting possession of firearms, etc.
paragraphText: an offence under section 423.1 (intimidation of a justice system participant),

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: When making an order under subsection (2), in the case of an accused who is charged with
marginalnotetext_y: Condition prohibiting possession of firearms, etc.
paragraphText: an offence relating to the contravention of any of sections 9 to 14 of the Cannabis Act,

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: When making an order under subsection (2), in the case of an accused who is charged with
marginalnotetext_y: Condition prohibiting possession of firearms, etc.
paragraphText: an offence relating to the contravention of any of sections 5 to 7 of the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act,

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: When making an order under subsection (2), in the case of an accused who is charged with
marginalnotetext_y: Condition prohibiting possession of firearms, etc.
paragraphText: an offence that involves, or the subject-matter of which is, a firearm, a cross-bow, a prohibited weapon, a restricted weapon, a prohibited device, ammunition, prohibited ammunition or an explosive substance, or

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: When making an order under subsection (2), in the case of an accused who is charged with
marginalnotetext_y: Condition prohibiting possession of firearms, etc.
paragraphText: an offence under subsection 20(1) of the Security of Information Act, or an offence under subsection 21(1) or 22(1) or section 23 of that Act that is committed in relation to an offence under subsection 20(1) of that Act,

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: When making an order under subsection (2), in the case of an accused who is charged with
marginalnotetext_y: Condition prohibiting possession of firearms, etc.
paragraphText: an offence under subsection 423.2(1) (intimidation — health services),

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Where the justice adds a condition described in subsection (4.1) to an order made under subsection (2), the justice shall specify in the order the manner and method by which
paragraphText: the things referred to in subsection (4.1) that are in the possession of the accused shall be surrendered, disposed of, detained, stored or dealt with; and

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Where the justice adds a condition described in subsection (4.1) to an order made under subsection (2), the justice shall specify in the order the manner and method by which
paragraphText: the authorizations, licences and registration certificates held by the person shall be surrendered.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Where the justice does not add a condition described in subsection (4.1) to an order made under subsection (2), the justice shall include in the record a statement of the reasons for not adding the condition.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Before making an order under subsection (2), in the case of an accused who is charged with an offence referred to in subsection (4.3), the justice shall consider whether it is desirable, in the interests of the safety and security of any person, particularly a victim of or witness to the offence or a justice system participant, to include as a condition of the order
paragraphText: that the accused abstain from communicating, directly or indirectly, with any victim, witness or other person identified in the order, except in accordance with any specified conditions that the justice considers necessary;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Before making an order under subsection (2), in the case of an accused who is charged with an offence referred to in subsection (4.3), the justice shall consider whether it is desirable, in the interests of the safety and security of any person, particularly a victim of or witness to the offence or a justice system participant, to include as a condition of the order
paragraphText: that the accused abstain from going to any place or entering any geographic area specified in the order, except in accordance with any specified conditions that the justice considers necessary; or

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Before making an order under subsection (2), in the case of an accused who is charged with an offence referred to in subsection (4.3), the justice shall consider whether it is desirable, in the interests of the safety and security of any person, particularly a victim of or witness to the offence or a justice system participant, to include as a condition of the order
paragraphText: that the accused comply with any other condition specified in the order that the justice considers necessary to ensure the safety and security of those persons.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: The offences for the purposes of subsection (4.2) are
paragraphText: a terrorism offence;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: The offences for the purposes of subsection (4.2) are
paragraphText: an offence in the commission of which violence against a person was used, threatened or attempted; and

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: The offences for the purposes of subsection (4.2) are
paragraphText: an offence under subsection 20(1) of the Security of Information Act, or an offence under subsection 21(1) or 22(1) or section 23 of that Act that is committed in relation to an offence under subsection 20(1) of that Act.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: The offences for the purposes of subsection (4.2) are
paragraphText: an offence described in section 264 or 423.1 or subsection 423.2(1);

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Where the prosecutor shows cause why the detention of the accused in custody is justified, the justice shall order that the accused be detained in custody until he is dealt with according to law and shall include in the record a statement of his reasons for making the order.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Unless the accused, having been given a reasonable opportunity to do so, shows cause why the accused’s detention in custody is not justified, the justice shall order, despite any provision of this section, that the accused be detained in custody until the accused is dealt with according to law, if the accused is charged
paragraphText: with an offence in the commission of which violence was allegedly used, threatened or attempted against their intimate partner, and the accused has been previously convicted of an offence in the commission of which violence was used, threatened or attempted against any intimate partner of theirs;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Unless the accused, having been given a reasonable opportunity to do so, shows cause why the accused’s detention in custody is not justified, the justice shall order, despite any provision of this section, that the accused be detained in custody until the accused is dealt with according to law, if the accused is charged
paragraphText: with an offence under any of subsections 145(2) to (5) that is alleged to have been committed while they were at large after being released in respect of another offence under the provisions of this Part or section 679, 680 or 816; or

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Unless the accused, having been given a reasonable opportunity to do so, shows cause why the accused’s detention in custody is not justified, the justice shall order, despite any provision of this section, that the accused be detained in custody until the accused is dealt with according to law, if the accused is charged
paragraphText: with an indictable offence, other than an offence listed in section 469,
subparagraphText: that is an offence under subsection 16(1) or (2), 17(1), 19(1), 20(1) or 22(1) of the Security of Information Act,

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Unless the accused, having been given a reasonable opportunity to do so, shows cause why the accused’s detention in custody is not justified, the justice shall order, despite any provision of this section, that the accused be detained in custody until the accused is dealt with according to law, if the accused is charged
paragraphText: with an indictable offence, other than an offence listed in section 469,
subparagraphText: that is an offence under subsection 21(1) or 22(1) or section 23 of the Security of Information Act committed in relation to an offence referred to in subparagraph (iv),

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Unless the accused, having been given a reasonable opportunity to do so, shows cause why the accused’s detention in custody is not justified, the justice shall order, despite any provision of this section, that the accused be detained in custody until the accused is dealt with according to law, if the accused is charged
paragraphText: with an indictable offence, other than an offence listed in section 469,
subparagraphText: that is alleged to have been committed while at large after being released in respect of another indictable offence pursuant to the provisions of this Part or section 679 or 680,

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Unless the accused, having been given a reasonable opportunity to do so, shows cause why the accused’s detention in custody is not justified, the justice shall order, despite any provision of this section, that the accused be detained in custody until the accused is dealt with according to law, if the accused is charged
paragraphText: with an indictable offence, other than an offence listed in section 469,
subparagraphText: that is an offence under section 467.11, 467.111, 467.12 or 467.13, or a serious offence alleged to have been committed for the benefit of, at the direction of, or in association with, a criminal organization,

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Unless the accused, having been given a reasonable opportunity to do so, shows cause why the accused’s detention in custody is not justified, the justice shall order, despite any provision of this section, that the accused be detained in custody until the accused is dealt with according to law, if the accused is charged
paragraphText: with an indictable offence, other than an offence listed in section 469,
subparagraphText: that is an offence under any of sections 83.02 to 83.04 and 83.18 to 83.23 or otherwise is alleged to be a terrorism offence,

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Unless the accused, having been given a reasonable opportunity to do so, shows cause why the accused’s detention in custody is not justified, the justice shall order, despite any provision of this section, that the accused be detained in custody until the accused is dealt with according to law, if the accused is charged
paragraphText: with an indictable offence, other than an offence listed in section 469,
subparagraphText: that is an offence under section 99, 100 or 103,

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Unless the accused, having been given a reasonable opportunity to do so, shows cause why the accused’s detention in custody is not justified, the justice shall order, despite any provision of this section, that the accused be detained in custody until the accused is dealt with according to law, if the accused is charged
paragraphText: with an indictable offence, other than an offence listed in section 469,
subparagraphText: that is an offence under section 244 or 244.2, or an offence under section 239, 272 or 273, subsection 279(1) or section 279.1, 344 or 346 that is alleged to have been committed with a firearm, or

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Unless the accused, having been given a reasonable opportunity to do so, shows cause why the accused’s detention in custody is not justified, the justice shall order, despite any provision of this section, that the accused be detained in custody until the accused is dealt with according to law, if the accused is charged
paragraphText: with an indictable offence, other than an offence listed in section 469,
subparagraphText: that is alleged to involve, or whose subject-matter is alleged to be, a firearm, a cross-bow, a prohibited weapon, a restricted weapon, a prohibited device, any ammunition or prohibited ammunition or an explosive substance, and that is alleged to have been committed while the accused was under a prohibition order within the meaning of subsection 84(1);

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Unless the accused, having been given a reasonable opportunity to do so, shows cause why the accused’s detention in custody is not justified, the justice shall order, despite any provision of this section, that the accused be detained in custody until the accused is dealt with according to law, if the accused is charged
paragraphText: with an indictable offence, other than an offence listed in section 469 and is not ordinarily resident in Canada,

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Unless the accused, having been given a reasonable opportunity to do so, shows cause why the accused’s detention in custody is not justified, the justice shall order, despite any provision of this section, that the accused be detained in custody until the accused is dealt with according to law, if the accused is charged
paragraphText: with having committed an offence punishable by imprisonment for life under any of sections 5 to 7 of the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act or the offence of conspiring to commit such an offence.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: If the justice orders that an accused to whom subsection (6) applies be released, the justice shall include in the record a statement of the justice’s reasons for making the order.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: For the purposes of subsections (5) and (6), it is sufficient if a record is made of the reasons in accordance with the provisions of Part XVIII relating to the taking of evidence at preliminary inquiries.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Despite subsection (9), if the justice orders that the accused be detained in custody primarily because of a previous conviction of the accused, the justice shall state that reason, in writing, in the record.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: For the purposes of this section, the detention of an accused in custody is justified only on one or more of the following grounds:
paragraphText: where the detention is necessary to ensure his or her attendance in court in order to be dealt with according to law;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: For the purposes of this section, the detention of an accused in custody is justified only on one or more of the following grounds:
paragraphText: where the detention is necessary for the protection or safety of the 		public, 	including any victim of or witness to the offence, or any person under the age of 18 years, having regard to all the circumstances including any substantial likelihood that the accused will, if released from custody, commit a criminal offence or interfere with the administration of justice; and

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: For the purposes of this section, the detention of an accused in custody is justified only on one or more of the following grounds:
paragraphText: if the detention is necessary to maintain confidence in the administration of justice, having regard to all the circumstances, including
subparagraphText: the apparent strength of the prosecution’s case,

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: For the purposes of this section, the detention of an accused in custody is justified only on one or more of the following grounds:
paragraphText: if the detention is necessary to maintain confidence in the administration of justice, having regard to all the circumstances, including
subparagraphText: the gravity of the offence,

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: For the purposes of this section, the detention of an accused in custody is justified only on one or more of the following grounds:
paragraphText: if the detention is necessary to maintain confidence in the administration of justice, having regard to all the circumstances, including
subparagraphText: the circumstances surrounding the commission of the offence, including whether a firearm was used, and

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: For the purposes of this section, the detention of an accused in custody is justified only on one or more of the following grounds:
paragraphText: if the detention is necessary to maintain confidence in the administration of justice, having regard to all the circumstances, including
subparagraphText: the fact that the accused is liable, on conviction, for a potentially lengthy term of imprisonment or, in the case of an offence that involves, or whose subject-matter is, a firearm, a minimum punishment of imprisonment for a term of three years or more.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: Where an accused who is charged with an offence mentioned in section 469 is taken before a justice, the justice shall order that the accused be detained in custody until he is dealt with according to law and shall issue a warrant in Form 8 for the committal of the accused.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: A justice who orders that an accused be detained in custody under this section may include in the order a direction that the accused abstain from communicating, directly or indirectly, with any victim, witness or other person identified in the order, except in accordance with such conditions specified in the order as the justice considers necessary.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: A justice who makes an order under this section shall include in the record of the proceedings a statement that he or she considered the safety and security of every victim of the offence when making the order.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: If an order is made under this section, the justice shall, on request by a victim of the offence, cause a copy of the order to be given to the victim.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: An order made under subsection (2) remains in force,
paragraphText: until it is varied or revoked;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: An order made under subsection (2) remains in force,
paragraphText: until an order in respect of the accused is made under section 515;

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: An order made under subsection (2) remains in force,
paragraphText: until the accused is acquitted of the offence, if applicable; or

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: An order made under subsection (2) remains in force,
paragraphText: until the time the accused is sentenced, if applicable.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: A justice may, before or at any time during the course of any proceedings under section 515, on application by the prosecutor or the accused, adjourn the proceedings and remand the accused to custody in prison by warrant in Form 19, but no adjournment shall be for more than three clear days except with the consent of the accused.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
subsectiontext: A justice who remands an accused to custody under subsection (1) or subsection 515(11) may order that the accused abstain from communicating, directly or indirectly, with any victim, witness or other person identified in the order, except in accordance with any conditions specified in the order that the justice considers necessary.

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Order directing matters not to be published for specified period
subsectiontext: If the prosecutor or the accused intends to show cause under section 515, he or she shall so state to the justice and the justice may, and shall on application by the accused, before or at any time during the course of the proceedings under that section, make an order directing that the evidence taken, the information given or the representations made and the reasons, if any, given or to be given by the justice shall not be published in any document, or broadcast or transmitted in any way before such time as
paragraphText: if a preliminary inquiry is held, the accused in respect of whom the proceedings are held is discharged; or

heading1titletext: Compelling Appearance of Accused Before a Justice and Interim Release
marginalnotetext_x: Order directing matters not to be published for specified period
subsectiontext: If the prosecutor or the accused intends to show cause under section 515, he or she shall so state to the justice and the justice may, and shall on application by the accused, before or at any time during the course of the proceedings under that section, make an order directing that the evidence taken, the information given or the representations made and the reasons, if any, given or to be given by the justice shall not be published in any document, or broadcast or transmitted in any way before such time as
